discussion.content: A is correct. To see the advertised distance you must enter show ip eigrp AS topology commad. With show IP route you see administrative distance/feaseble distance

questions.answer_description:
R1`s routing table is as follows

The numbers after the route specify the administrative distance of the route (90 for EIGRP) and the distance metric of that particular route, which is shows as
1810944 for the 192.168.46.0 route.

choices.B: The Hello packets will be exchanged but the routers R2 and R5 will become neighbors only.
choices.A: The Hello packets will be exchanged and adjacency will be established between routers R2 and R5.
choices.D: The Hello packets will be dropped but the routers R2 and R5 will become neighbors.
choices.C: The Hello packets will be dropped and no adjacency will be established between routers R2 and R5.

questions.answer_description: The point of this question is the conditions of OSPF establish adjacency relationship. For ospf, the optional capabilities must set the same between neighbors, but from the exhibit, R5 was configured as a stub area while R2 in area 0 is a normal area. So there will be no adjacent relationship established between routers R2 and R5.

discussion.content: From the configuration output there is seen that R2 is configured with a "stub" keyword for Area 5 and R5 is not configured with the very same keyword "... stub".

choices.B: They are originated by the DR on every multi-access network. They include all attached routers including the DR itself.
choices.D: They are originated by Area Border Router and are sent into a single area to advertise an Autonomous System Border Router.
choices.A: They are originated by every router in the OPSF network. They include all routers on the link, interfaces, the cost of the link, and any known neighbor on the link.
choices.C: They are originated by Area Border Routers and are sent into a single area to advertise destinations outside that area.

questions.answer: Incorrect Answer: OSPF Network LSAs are not originated by Area Border Routers.
questions.answer_description:
The point of this question is OSPF Network LSAs
The feature of OSPF Network LSAs is that they are generated by DR, and DR only exist on multi-access network, the use of OSPF Network LSAs is that it list all neighbors around and send it to every router which run OSPF.
questions.question_text: Which statement is true about OSPF Network LSAs?
questions.answer_ET: Incorrect Answer: OSPF Network LSAs are not originated by Area Border Routers.

discussion.content: The routes are to appear with a code "0 E2" meaning an "O" (like OSPF) is missing.

questions.answer_description: When you configure the ip default-network command and specify a subnet, a static route (the ip route command) is generated in the router`s configuration; however, the IOS does not display a message to indicate that this has been done. The entry appears as a static route in the routing table of the router where the command is configured. This can be confusing when you want to remove the default network; the configuration must be removed with the no ip route command, not with the no ip default-network command.
questions.question_text: In EIGRP, when the IP default-network command is configured on a router, what is generated in the router`s configuration?
